Pronouns - Indefinites A final type of pronouns is indefinites. There are two basic sets of indefinite pronouns, though not all languages merge them into a single word:
those consisting of a quantifier and an indefinite generic noun, such as everybody, everything, everyone, anybody, anything, anyone, somebody, something, someone, and
those built from an word, such as whoever and whatever.
Beginning with the first type above that includes a quantifier, such as ‘everybody’, ‘anything’ and ‘someone’, how does your language express these indefinites?
